wikitext.*:
'''''athrad''''' (pl. ''ethraid'') is a noun meaning "(river-)crossing, ford, way" in [[Sindarin]].<ref>{{UT|Cirion}}, note 47</ref><ref>{{VT|42a}}, p. 7</ref><ref>{{HM|N}}, p. 775</ref><ref name=RC163>{{HM|RC}}, p. 163 (manuscript notes to the ''[[Guide to the Names in The Lord of the Rings|Nomenclature]]'')</ref><ref>[[Didier Willis]], [http://www.jrrvf.com/hisweloke/sindar/online/sindar/dict-sd-en.html Hiswelókë's Sindarin Dictionary] (accessed 9 December 2010)</ref> 
==Etymology==
It is composed of ''[[ath-]]'' "on both sides, across" and ''[[râd]]'' "path, track".<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, pp. 349, 383</ref>

==Examples==
* [[Athrad Angren]]
* [[Sarn Athrad]]
==See also==
*''[[athrada]]'' "to cross, traverse"
*''[[iach]]'' (Sindarin "ford")
